The devastating earthquake in Peru this week left more than 500 people dead, and the nightmare is not over for the tens of thousands of survivors.

Peru's President Alan Garcia has called for calm, but reports say aide workers have not managed to get supplies to some of the hardest-hit areas.
We get an update now from freelance journalist Guillermo Galdos in the coastal town of Pisco.
Thank you for talking with us.
Thank you to you.
The quake struck on Wednesday.
Can you describe the scene for us there today, three days later?
Well, the rescue teams just arrived two nights ago and so the second night they've been working.

And this guy, he said to me very clearly that he thought that the number of dead people could easily go up to a thousand or more.
